body: ### Describe the bug When `with cython.nogil(PARAM):` is used, the `PARAM` is ignored and GIL is release in any case - see the example. The example produces following code: On the other hand in the Cython syntax the parameter is not ignored and providing `True` in the example, the lock is not relased: ```cython def increment(int x): with nogil(False): x = x + 1 return x print(increment(5)) ``` This behavior contradicts the documentation here: https://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/src/tutorial/pure.html#managing-the-global-interpreter-lock ### Code to reproduce the behaviour: ```cython import cython def increment(x: cython.int): with cython.nogil(False): x = x + 1 return x print(increment(5)) ``` ### Expected behaviour One of following: 1. Pure version has same behaviour as Cython one 2. Documentation is fixed ### Environment OS: macOS Python version 3.9 Cython version master ### Additional context `cython.gil()` seems to be also (at least partially affected/broken: * In cython following code generates C code: ```cython def increment(int x): with nogil(False): x = x + 1 with gil(False): print(x) return x print(increment(5)) ``` > Note: Also works for providing `True` instead of `False` to `gil`/`nogil` On the other hand following code fails to compile: ```cython import cython def increment(x: cython.int): with cython.nogil(True): x = x + 1 with cython.gil(True): print(x) return x print(increment(5)) ``` For both `True`/`False` parametrers in `cython.gil`, `cython.nogil` On the other hand following code works: ```python import cython def increment(x: cython.int): with cython.nogil: x = x + 1 with cython.gil: print(x) return x print(increment(5)) ```
title: [BUG] `cython.nogil` does not support function parameters in pure mode
